intro: Espostoa huanucoensis, commonly known as the Huanuco nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of Peru. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of violet or purple flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
